title: FCC approves 7,500 additional Starlink satellites
summary:
The FCC approved a second tranche of 7,500 Starlink Gen2 satellites Jan. 9, expanding the size of SpaceX’s authorized next-generation constellation.

title: MaiaSpace to Launch “Minimum Viable Product” in 2026
summary:
French small launch services provider MaiaSpace has explained that an initial flight of its Maia rocket in 2026 will represent the deployment of a “minimum viable product.” MaiaSpace was founded in 2022 as a wholly-owned subsidiary of ArianeGroup. The company is developing a partially reusable two-stage rocket called Maia that is designed to be capable […]

title: Shaken, Not Stirred: NASA’s StarBurst Aces Extreme Temperature Tests
summary: Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled – NASA’s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agency’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. title: Flight Engineers Give NASA’s Dragonfly Lift
summary: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturn’s moon Titan, NASA’s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. title: L3Harris announces $845 million majority sale of Space Propulsion and Power Systems business
summary: The deal with AE Industrial Partners is expected to close in the second half of 2026. L3Harris will retain full control over the RS-25 engine.
